title: The Balance-of-Power Theory Strikes Again
content: Nobody should be surprised at how the world is reacting to Donald Trump’s threats.
creator: Stephen M. Walt

title: Why Latin America Has Been Demure in Davos
content: U.S. aggression is nothing new for the region.

title: Why Trump Should Accept Putin’s New START Offer
content: Extending the nuclear treaty is not about trust—it’s about pragmatism.
creator: Ariel Petrovics

title: The Look of Empire
content: Donald Trump’s dangerous fixation with imperial aesthetics.
creator: Krzysztof Pelc

title: Trump Launches ‘Board of Peace’ in Davos
content: With nearly 25 countries already signed on, critics fear that the new body could challenge the United Nations’ authority.
creator: Maxine Davey

title: Carney Come Lately
content: The Canadian leader’s Davos speech is a masterclass in realism—and an overdue admission of hypocrisy.
creator: Alejandro Reyes

title: The Board of Discord
content: Trump’s “Board of Peace” is neither an alternative to the U.N. nor a harmless vanity project but a threat to international cooperation.
creator: Richard Gowan and Daniel Forti

title: TACOs in Greenland?
content: The U.S. president followed up a concerning speech with a confusing announcement.
creator: Rishi Iyengar

title: Europe Is the U.S. Establishment’s Last Hope
content: Trump’s Greenland spectacle has liberal-minded Americans rooting for the other guy.

title: Trump’s Greenland Obsession Is Madness. Can’t We Just Say That?
content: The commentariat persists in misrepresenting the U.S. president and his actions.
creator: Christian Caryl

title: How Israel Is Navigating International Boycotts
content: Economy Minister Nir Barkat: “We’ll do better business in places that want us.”
creator: Ravi Agrawal

title: Trump’s Golden Dome Is No Silver Bullet
content: Nearly one year on, one of the biggest U.S. defense proposals remains little more than a concept.

title: Why Iran’s Regime Didn’t Collapse
content: The Islamic Republic was built to withstand sustained unrest.

title: Trump Talks Greenland at Davos, Announces ‘Framework’ Deal
content: The U.S. president said he and the NATO secretary-general “formed the framework of a future deal” but provided few details.

title: Europe Is Prepared to Create Its Own Army
content: As the United States blusters and threatens, European leaders are making tough choices.
creator: Luke McGee

title: New U.S. Tariffs Imperil Indian-Backed Port in Iran
content: An infrastructure project between Afghanistan, Iran, and India gets caught in Trump’s crosshairs—again.

content: Firing central bank governors may prove to be a red line.

title: Young Africans Are Being Lured Into Russia’s War Machine
content: The Kremlin may be using Africans as suicide bombers in Ukraine, reports suggest.

title: To Protect Greenland, Europe Kicks Into High Gear
content: The continent is finally showing some strategic resolve. Will it last?
creator: Michele Barbero

title: U.S. Congress Sidesteps Greenland Debate in Defense Spending Bill
content: Lawmakers opted against using the power of the purse to forbid forcible annexation of Greenland.

title: In Davos, a Tale of Two Speeches
content: Trump follows Greenland threats by announcing a “future deal,” while Canada’s prime minister describes it all as a “rupture in the world order.”

content: In his speech in Davos, Trump asked for the territory and said only the United States could defend it.

title: Vice Presidents Usually Disappoint After Calamity Strikes
content: Delcy Rodríguez is the latest spare politician to be thrust into a top job.

title: ‘A Rupture in the World Order’
content: Read Canadian Prime Minister Mark Carney’s forceful speech at Davos rebuking Trump’s world order.

title: The U.S. Military Can’t Fix Iran’s Opposition
content: Washington can intervene militarily, but any regime change strategy needs to start in Iran itself.
